name: PETERSON 25 1/4 TON
notes:
There were several Doug Peterson designed 1/4 tonners so, dimensions here are very appoximate.
A very rough time line:

1973: Built on a semi-custom basis by Carl Eichenlaub.

1974: Similar but updated version, molds by Posiedon Yachts many of which were sold as kits.
Also built by Chita Marine. Chaser. Yachts by Bayliner, (US 25) were probably splashed copies.)

1976: New design, Star Eyed Stella (4th 1976 Worlds).

1978: Daggerboard version. SEAWAY 25 (Stephenson Marine in Australia.)978: New design. Chita Marine. Ultimately became the CONRAD 560, of which many are sailing to this day in Eastern Europe and Russia.
It is thought that the YAMAHA 25 is also based on this latter design.
